content.description: Techy .11+ climbing through the first few bolts leads to a good rest before launching in to the difficult crux section on holds that are barely there. Then keep your shit together for the pumpy finish to the top!
content.location: Furthest left rout at the wall. Starts about 20 feet lower than the other routes at the sector.

content.description: One of the longer pitches at the WoM, with lots of varied movement and holds. The first 3 bolts is the crux, with a redpoint crux up high.
content.location: The furthest right route in the Prairie Fire Sector. Just right of Black Rain.

content.description: Two distinct cruxes on prominent orange and brown streaked prow.During the war in Vietnam a group of special operations forces conducted numerous secret missions behind enemy lines. During these missions, when contact with the enemy was made and gunfire prevented advance or retreat, radio communications would call out a "Prairie Fire Emergency" to summon air support and evac.
content.location: Black bolt hangers, left of Black Rain

content.description: Excellent movement up a gently overhanging, streaked wall. The crux comes at bolt 4, with a powerful undercling move to a slick edge. Get some.
content.location: Center of the Prairie Fire Sector, just right of Lambs to the Cosmic Slaughter.

content.description: Start by traversing right up a smooth, blank slab to a dihedral. Step on the pillar and start up the headwall using good feet out right. Big moves near the top (crux) with thin climbing to the anchor. Beautiful rock!
content.location: Middle route on pillar starts up obvious seam slab traverse

content.description: Farthest left zone at the wall, easily identified by the large orange and brown streaks. This zone has the highest concentration of harder routes.
